name: Lost for Words! 4 Quiz | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text:
Which word completes this well-known song lyric?
'I just _______ to say I love you 
And I mean it from the bottom of my heart.'
questions.explanation:
called.

	This Motown track was a hit for Stevie Wonder in 1984. 'I Just Called To Say I Love You' topped the charts in both the UK and the USA.

questions.text:
'I may not always love you 
But long as there are _______ above you.'
Which word is missing from this Beach Boys lyric?
questions.explanation:
stars.

	These lyrics come from the Beach Boys hit 'God Only Knows', which was a #2 hit in the UK in 1966.

questions.text:
Which TV or radio station initials are missing from this Dire Straits track?
'Now look at them yo-yos that's the way you do it. 
You play the guitar on the ______. 
That ain't workin' that's the way you do it 
Money for nothin' and chicks for free.'
questions.explanation:
MTV.

	'Money for Nothin' was written by the group's lead singer Mark Knopfler. This 1985 track from the Dire Straits album 'Brothers In Arms' got to #1 in the US and #4 in the UK.

questions.text:
'Nothing you could say 
Can tear me away from my ______ .'
Which word is missing from this classic Mary Wells track?
questions.explanation:
guy.

	Another Motown track, this one was a hit for Mary Wells in 1964. 'My Guy' peaked at #1 in the US and #5 in the UK charts.

questions.text:
Which nation is missing from this song lyric?
'Tell all the folks in Russia, and ______, too
Don't you know that it's time to get on board
And let this train keep on riding, riding on through.'
questions.explanation:
China.

	The lyric comes from the O'Jays 1973 hit 'Love Train'. A #1 hit in the US it peaked at #9 in the UK.

questions.text:
Another nation for you to find in this tune from Madonna.
'Don't cry for me ______ .
The truth is I never left you.'
Which nation is it?
questions.explanation:
Argentina.

	'Don't Cry for Me Argentina', a 1996 hit for Madonna, was written by Tim Rice. This tune featured in the musical 'Evita'. Madonna has worldwide sales of more than 140 million records.

questions.text:
Queen sang the song, but which word is missing?
'Another one bites the ______ 
Hey, I'm gonna get you too 
Another one bites the ______'
questions.explanation:
dust.

	Queen hit the charts with 'Another One Bites The Dust' in 1980. A chart topper in the US it peaked at #7 in the UK.

questions.text:
'If you knew ______, then you'd know why I feel blue.'
Do you know the girl's name that is missing from this Buddy Holly Lyric?
questions.explanation:
Peggy Sue.

	'Peggy Sue' was a 1957 for Buddy Holly. Buddy's auspicious career was tragically cut-short when he was killed in a plane crash in 1959.

questions.text:
Which word fills the gaps in this song?
'Woman, take me in your arms
Rock your ______.
Woman, take me in your arms
Rock your ______.'
questions.explanation:
baby.

	George McCrae hit the charts with 'Rock Your Baby' in 1974. This disco track topped both the US and UK charts.

questions.text:
'______ men say only fools rush in 
but I can't help falling in love with you.'
Elvis sang the words, but which one is missing?
questions.explanation:
Wise.

	'Can't Help Falling In Love' was a hit for Elvis - The King of Rock 'n' Roll - Presley in 1962. The single peaked at #23 in the US, and topped the UK chart.
